column5: Description
column6: Test steps
column7: Expected result

column5:
Testing the ability to add a Comment
Comment - is a feature in the conversation that let's a user add a comment and contribute
column6:
1)Go to: The publisher's conversation
2)Click on SayConrol
3)write a comment
4)Click "post"
column7: The Comment will be added to the feed

column5: Testing the ability the rich edit a comment in the Comment sayCtrl
column6:
1)Go to: The publisher's conversation
2)Click on SayConrol
3)write a comment
4)Click the rich editor
5)Edit the text
6)Click "post"
column7: The Comment with rich text will be added to the feed

column5:
Testing the ability to update a comment.
Edit -  is a feature that lets the user change their comment after they clicking post.
column6:
1)Go to: The publisher's conversation
2)Click on SayConrol
3)write a comment
4)Click "post"
5)click edit
6)Change the comment
7)Click update
column7:
1)After clicking edit - a SayCtrl will appear with the comment the user wants to update
2)After clicking update the new text will appear in the conversation, and "edited" 
will appear next to the timestamp

column5:
Testing the ability to update a comment.
Edit - is a feature that lets the user change their comment after they clicking post.
In TOL you cannot edit after 5 minutes
column6:
1)Go to: The publisher's conversation
2)Click on SayConrol
3)write a comment
4)Click "post"
5)Wait 5 minutes
5)Choose edit
column7: You will not have the option to edit after 5 minutes

column5:
Testing the ability to update a comment.
Edit -  is a feature that lets the user change their comment after they clicking post.
column6:
1)Go to: The publisher's conversation
2)Click on SayConrol
3)write a comment
4)Click "post"
5)click edit
6)Change the comment
7)Click update
8)Change the comment
9)Click cancel
column7: 1)Your comment will not be changed

column5:
Testing the ability to delete a comment
Delete - is a feature that lets the user delete their comment after posting it.
column6:
1)Go to: https://dynamic-cdn.staging-spot.im/modules/launcher/demos/deferred/conversation-only.html
2)Click on SayConrol
3)write a comment
4)Click "post"
5)click delete
6)refresh the page
column7:
1)The comment will be deleted
2)After the refresh the comment will still not appear

column5: Verify Cancel button for publishers who have it
column6:
1. On the sun, we implemented a Cancel button for the SayCTL: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1HDEdUTqeMdPY1XAXkR6V3fb8_oGy5DA8
1. Go to https://preview.c9users.io/borisyuz/staging_env/sun/post1.html
2. Open main SayCTL, and write some text
3. Click Cancel
column7: SatCTL is minimized to the original state

column5:
Testing if adding a reply works
reply - is a feature in the conversation that lets a user reply to a comment or reply to a reply
column6:
1)Go to: The publisher's website
2)To a comment click reply
3)write a reply
4)Click "post"
column7: The reply will be added with an indentation

column5:
Testing the ability to update a reply.
Edit - is a feature that lets the user change their reply after they clicking post.
column6:
1)Do TC505
2)Choose edit
3)Change the comment
4)Click update
column7:
1)After clicking edit - a SayCtrl will appear with the reply the user wants to update
2)After clicking update the new text will appear in the conversation

column5:
Testing the ability to delete a reply
Delete - is a feature that lets the user delete their reply after posting it.
column6:
1)Do TC505
2)Hover over the reply
3)Choose delete
4)refresh the page
column7:
1)The reply will be deleted
2)After the refresh the reply will still not appear

column5: Verify Cancel button on replies for publishers who have it
column6:
1. On the sun, we implemented a Cancel button for the SayCTL: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1HDEdUTqeMdPY1XAXkR6V3fb8_oGy5DA8
1. Go to https://preview.c9users.io/borisyuz/staging_env/sun/post1.html
2. On any comment, click the Reply button, and add text
3. Click Cancel
column7: SayCTL is minimized to its original state

column6:
1)Go to a publisher's site with user A
2)With user A type and dont stop
3)Go to the publisher's site with User B to the same conversation
column7: 1)User B will see User A typing(The first letter of the user)

column6:
1)Go to a publisher's site with a few users
2)with those user type
3)With a completely different user go to the same conversation
column7: 1)You will see a user typing and in the middle of the avatar the number of users typing will appear

column6:
1)Do:TC532
2)post few of the typers comments
column7:
1)For user B and aggregation will appear 
2)The first comment posted and under if will be a button "view more comments"

column5: Liking a comment in the conversation
column6:
1)Go to: The publisher's site
2)Like a comment
column7: The number of likes to the comment will increase by one

column5: Disliking a comment in the conversation
column6:
1)Go to: The publisher's site
2)Dislike a comment
column7: The number of dislikes to the comment will increase by one

column5: Liking a reply in the conversation
column6:
1)Go to: The publisher's site
2)Like a reply
column7: The number of likes to the reply will increase by one

column5: Disliking a reply in the conversation
column6:
1)Go to: The publisher's site
2)Dislike a reply
column7: The number of dislikes to the reply will increase by one

column5:
Testing the ability to report a comment with replies.
Report - is the ability of a user to report an offensive comment.
column6:
1)Go to:https://preview.c9users.io/borisyuz/staging_env/Manual/post1.html
2)Hover over a comment with no replies
3)Click on the context menu icon
4)Choose report
column7: 1)The comment will disappear from the reporters view.

column5:
Testing the ability to report a comment with replies.
Report - is the ability of a user to report an offensive comment.
column6:
1)Go to:https://preview.c9users.io/borisyuz/staging_env/Manual/post1.html
2)Hover over a comment with replies
3)Click on the context menu icon
4)Choose report
column7: 1)The comment will disappear from the reporters view but the replies will stay

column5:
Testing the ability to report a reply
Report - is the ability of a user to report an offensive reply.
column6:
1)Go to:https://preview.c9users.io/borisyuz/staging_env/Manual/post1.html
2)Hover over a reply
3)Click on the context menu icon
4)Choose report
column7: 1)The reply will disappear from the reporters view but the replies will stay

column5:
Testing the ability to report a reply with replies.
Report - is the ability of a user to report an offensive reply.
column6:
1)Go to:https://preview.c9users.io/borisyuz/staging_env/Manual/post1.html
2)Hover over a reply with replies
3)Click on the context menu icon
4)Choose report
column7: 1)The reply will disappear from the reporters view but the replies will stay

column5: Notifications - is a feature that notifies a user when they are replies to or their comment is mentioned or they are mentioned
column6:
1)The publisher's site
2)Log in
3)Click on the notification bell, 
4)Click on a notification that is in view(A notification that appear in the conversation you are currently without the need to click "Show more comment")
column7: 1)The message will be highlighted and you will be scrolled to the message

column5: Notifications - is a feature that notifies a user when they are replies to or their comment is mentioned or they are mentioned
column6:
1)The publisher's site
2)Log in
3)Click on the notification bell
4)Click on a notification that is not in view(A notification that appear in the conversation and you need to click "Show more comment" to see it)
column7:
The message will appear as the first 
message in the conversation and highlighted

column5: Notifications - is a feature that notifies a user when they are replies to or their comment is mentioned or they are mentioned
column6:
1)The publisher's site
2)Log in
3)Click on the notification bell
4)click on a notification from a different 
conversation
column7:
1)You will be redirected to the conversation
the notification is from, and the message 
will be highlighted.

column5: Testing conversation on USA VPN
column6:
1)Go to a conversation
2)Turn on USA VPN
3)Run the conversation sanity
column7:
1)The conversation will load
2)Te conversation will act as in the Israeli VPN

column5: Testing conversation on EU VPN
column6:
1)Go to a conversation
2)Turn on EU VPN
3)Run the conversation sanity
column7:
1)The conversation will load
2)Te conversation will act as in the Israeli VPN

column6:
1. Go to admin login page
2. Using your credentials, login
column7:
1. In spots dropdown you see all spots you are owner of, moderator of, and viewer of in alphabetical order in each section
2. User can see settings, analytics, features tabs as well as moderators tab.
3. For enabled community spots, user will also see topic pages

column6:
1. Configure user as journalist
2. Login on staging with journalist user
column7: Login fails and the "Request Demo" page appears

column6:
1. Configure user as moderator on a certain spot
2. Login with moderator user
column7:
User can see only moderation tab, with all related sub-tabs.
If spot has multiple moderators mode enabled, user will see toggle of moderation mode. Off by default

column6:
1)Go to the publisher's site
2)Log in in the conversation as admin
3)Post a comment
column7:
1)Next to the user name a badge will appear "Staff member"
2)The user's avatar will be the publisher's avatar

column6:
1)Go to the publisher's site
2)Log in in the conversation as moderator
3)Post a comment
column7:
1)Next to the user name a badge will appear "Staff member"
2)The user's avatar will be the publisher's avatar

column6:
1)Go to the publisher's site
2)Log in in the conversation as journalist
3)Post a comment
column7:
1)Next to the user name a badge will appear "Staff member"
2)The user's avatar will be the publisher's avatar

column6:
Pre Step: In the host panel enable Bozo
1)Go to the publisher's site
2)Choose a conversation
3)Add a comment with a restricted word
column7:
1)The user will see the comment added like any other comment
2)In the host panel the comment will go to pending/rejected

column6:
Pre Step: In the host panel disable Bozo
1)Go to the publisher's site
2)Choose a conversation
3)Add a comment with a restricted word
column7: 1)The comment will appear greyed and the badge pending approval will appear
